data.title: Revert "Store instructions as shared pointers instead of as values"
data.body: Reverts 4ian/GD#121

data.title: Store instructions as shared pointers instead of as values
data.body:
- Adds a gd::SPtrList template (gd::InstructionsList is just a typedef of SPtrListgd::Instruction).
- Replace all vectors of gd::Instruction with gd::InstructionsList.
- Fix the bug when moving a condition into an OR condition.

data.title: Fix GDevelop deb not depending on build-essential
data.body: ${shlibs:Depends}, ${misc:Depends} create an automatic list of dependency. But how can Launchpad know that GDevelop needs build-essential ?

data.title: Get container for layers
data.body: Just a clean method to get the PIXI container of a layer :smiley:

data.title: Fix sound/music playing offset in GDCpp
data.body: Fix sound/music playing offset in GDCpp

data.title: HTML5 Draggable automatism : Cannot set property 'originalEvent' of undefined
data.body:
This error happens with objects that have the draggable automatism when changing scene. It prevents XDK app to be built.
See : http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=20&t=6420&p=49869 and http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=19&t=6385&p=49691

data.title: Avoid objects and groups with the same name
data.body:
This fix improve the object's name check.
It avoids : 
- Creating an object/a group with the same name as another object or group (from the layout and global)
- Renaming an object/a group to the same name as another object or group (from the layout and global)
- Set an object/a group global if another object or group from another scene has the same name.

GDevelop shows an error message to the user that describes the problem and even tells the scenes containing objects/groups with the same name (if GDevelop can't set an object global)

data.title: Release GD 3.7.80 on Ubuntu 15.04
data.body: Release GD 3.7.80 on Ubuntu 15.04

data.title: Bugfix objects with same name
Fix sprite global color in HTML5
data.body:
The action to modify the sprites global color is broken, this should fix it :smiley: 
Actually, just colors[2] needs to be converted to int, but this way is more clear.

data.title: [Mistake 2] Fix sprite global color in HTML5
data.body: Sorry again, GitHub for Windows has no way to keep track current commits :(

data.title: [Mistake] Merge pull request #2 from 4ian/master
data.body: Sorry, little mistake with new software :D

data.title: Macro to disable the update dialog
data.body:
Remove the possibility to open the update dialog (MAJ) when the cmake option NO_UPDATE_CHECKER (which define GD_NO_UPDATE_CHECKER in the source code) is defined.
It's "useful" (I know, not a lot) for the gdevelop linux packages as the update process is already managed by the package manager.

data.title: Remove borders in the eventsPanel from the EventEditor
data.body: On wxGTK, borders appear around the event editor. This commit removes them.

data.title: Fix images insertion order when adding multiple picture to an animation
data.body:
Fix images insertion order when adding multiple picture to an animation of a sprite object.
(the boolean parameter of the wxArrayString::Sort method applies a reverse sort).

data.title: Fix the high cpu usage when switching to the event editor on Linux
data.body: It doesn't use HasFocus() as a condition to enable the idle events because this condition is not fulfilled if we use the debugger during the preview.

data.title: CPU usage stay at 100% when using events editor on Linux
data.body: See http://www.forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=20&t=6223

data.title: [Feature Request] Scale snapping
data.body: It would be nice if the snap to grid functionality would also affect the scaling of sprites. That way uniform scaling of different sprites would be easier.

data.title: Fix extension not copied to the destination directory on Linux/MacOS
data.body: A fix for #102. Need a new 3.6.79 version because it's a big bug.

data.title: C++ Compiled games not working
data.body: The extensions seems not to be loaded resulting in a lot of "WARNING : Unknown object type/automatism XXXXXXX" and the game doesn't work.

data.title: Platformer engine optimizations
Force browsers to avoid loading cached files
data.body:
Browsers tends to cache JS files and serve these cached files, which can be a problem when launching preview/updating to a new version of GDevelop, because most users won't think use Ctrl+F5 (or Ctrl+Shift+R) to clear the cache.

Adding query with a a timestamp to the filenames of JS files when generating index.html (so `file.js` become `file.js?q=[timestamp]`) should do the trick

data.title: Replace Arial by Liberation (a free font licensed under SIL OFL 1.1)
data.body:
Arial is a proprietary font and should not be embedded in a free project like GDevelop.
So, Liberation can be used instead : this font is licensed under the SIL Open Font License 1.1 and can be embedded in any projects (free or non free). The characters of this font have the same size as the ones of Arial.

data.title: Added 'all files' filter to opendialog in preferences - external image editor
data.body:
Currently there is only one ".exe" filter present in the linux build which prevents you from finding any linux executables.
This commit adds an 'All Files' filter to the open file dialog for external image editors in options - preferences.

data.title: Linux: "Add from resource library" dialog not responding to input
data.body:
If you create a new object and try to choose an image from the resource library the corresponding dialog will open but not respond to any input. Even closing (x) doesn't work, the window only closes if you close the parent "edition of a sprite" window.
As a workaround you can load the images from the "images bank" first but this way you won't see any previews of the pics in the folder tree.

My system:
Linux Mint 17.1 Cinnamon 64Bit

data.title: Some little issues
data.body:
- Fix wrong platform in the Slot machine example
- Fix a PNG encoded in 8 bits preventing the Platformer with tilemap example to run correctly

data.title: Releasing GDevelop 3.6.79
data.body:
I think it's time to release GD 3.6.79: I'd like to get feedbacks (@victorlevasseur ?) to know if you think there are still major issues to fix or if everything looks ok?

My Ubuntu/Windows computer sort of crashed (Ubuntu crashed last time with an alarming error concerning sda, I didn't get any time to check this out since I'm working on the Mac I have now) so I didn't made extensive tests on real systems these latest times, just checked compilation and if basic things work on VMs.

data.title: Fix SFML not linked to GDIDE.exe and GDIDE_dev.exe
data.body: Second part of the fix for #92.

data.title: Fix variables from Extlibs/CMakeLists.txt on Windows
data.body:
Need to set the variables locally then set them in the PARENT_SCOPE
(Fix for #92)
